title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, narrated by the young Scout Finch.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic story of Jay Gatsby's unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan, set in the Jazz Age of America.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of Elizabeth Bennet, the protagonist.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about the experiences of a young man named Holden Caulfield, dealing with complex themes of identity, belonging, and alienation.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale Moby Dick.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era on Tsarist society.
